descript.abstract: This feature class contains structure (building) polygons for the state/territory of Virginia. This update (as of 5/02/2023) is provided with additional attributions, where available: OCC_CLS, PRIM_OCC, PROP_ADDR, PROP_CITY, PROP_ZIP, and PROP_ST. They have been populated with the best available data from sources cited in the source section. The structures (buildings) are represented by polygon geometries with an attribute table described elsewhere in the metadata.
descript.purpose: This dataset was created to inventory all structures in the US and its territories whose size is greater than 450 square feet. It provides cartographic context for urban density, patterns of use, visual reference, and navigation support.

timeperd.current: Time period date range corresponds to the IM_DATE field of the feature class.

cntorgp.cntorg: Federal Emergency Management Agency â€“ Response Geospatial Office

idinfo.datacred: Oak Ridge National Laboratory (ORNL); Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) Geospatial Response Office

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy test was conducted. Data from the authoritative sources are assumed to be correct and accurate.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical consistency tests were conducted.
dataqual.complete: No formal completeness tests were conducted; however, data capture is complete as of the most recent date indicated in the Time Period section.

horizpa.horizpar: None; however, the horizontal positional accuracy of derived features is directly correlated to the accuracy of the imagery used to extract the feature. WorldView-2 and WorldView-3 sensors have a reported geolocation accuracy of less than 3.5 meters. NAIP reports a horizontal accuracy of at least 5 meters within a 1 meter ground sample distance.

vertacc.vertaccr: None; however, the vertical positional accuracy correlates to the accuracy of LiDAR and other elevation sources used to derive vertical information.

srcinfo.srccontr: Geometries and height information were included
Input Imagery from which features were extracted
Input Imagery from which features were extracted
Input Imagery from which features were extracted
A spatial intersection for occupancy classification with aggregated land use codes where appropriate
A spatial intersection for occupancy classification
A spatial intersection for occupancy classification
GEOID and FIPS included via spatial join
Street Number, Street Name, Zip, and City where appropriate

procstep.procdesc: Scalable High-Resolution Imagery-Based Building Extraction Pipeline (SCRIBE): High-resolution multispectral imagery is obtained for the area of interest. The raw imagery (Level-1B product) is then pan-sharpened and orthorectified. Complete coverage with minimal cloud cover includes overhead imagery and LiDAR-derived footprints with a spatial resolution less than 0.7 meters. Once imagery pre-processing completes, high performance computing (HPC) environments at ORNL are used to apply a convolutional neural network (CNN) model to the imagery to automatically extract structure boundaries.
Verification and Validation Model (VVM): Verification and validation of the output produced from SCRIBE is conducted by a machine learning model to remove potential false positives.

Regularization: The visual representation of the structures has been improved to represent structure geometry more accurately as compared to the imagery-derived raster representations from the SCRIBE pipeline. This step also reduces the number of vertices represented by a structure, thus reducing file size and improving render speeds.
Attribution and Metadata: Population of some attributes is incomplete and identified in the Entity and Attribute Information section of this metadata.
Phase 2 attribute expansion: Population of OCC_CLS, PRIM_OCC, PROP_ADDR, PROP_CITY, PROP_ZIP, and PROP_ST with best available data. Coverage of address related fields maybe incomplete.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
Unique ID for each feature.
This identifies the top level building occupancy class as defined by Locations: Building Occupancy Classification; FEMA Data Standard; July 31, 2018.

codesetd.codesetn: Locations: Building Occupancy Classification; FEMA Data Standard; July 31, 2018
codesetd.codesets: Contact FEMA at 500 C Street SW, Washington, DC 20024, 202-341-1426

attr.attrdef: This identifies the primary descriptor for a building's usage for each top level building occupancy class as defined by Locations: Building Occupancy Classification; FEMA Data Standard; July 31, 2018.

codesetd.codesetn: Locations: Building Occupancy Classification; FEMA Data Standard; July 31, 2018
codesetd.codesets: Contact FEMA at 500 C Street SW, Washington, DC 20024, 202-341-1426

attr.attrdef: This describes the range of units within Multi Family Dwelling and Temporary Lodging descriptors for Residential building occupancy class as defined by Locations: Building Occupancy Classification; FEMA Data Standard; July 31, 2018.

codesetd.codesetn: Locations: Building Occupancy Classification; FEMA Data Standard; July 31, 2018
codesetd.codesets: Contact FEMA at 500 C Street SW, Washington, DC 20024, 202-341-1426

attr.attrdef: Primary street address for a structure (i.e. 5th Avenue and Main Street).
City name.
State name.
Zip code (5 digit).
A non-primary structure or outbuilding such as a garage, shed or other accessory building.
This is a measure of the height (in meters) of the structure as determined from LiDAR or other source data.
attr.attrdefs: LiDAR-derived footprints where available provided by NGA

attr.attrdef: This is the two-dimensional area of the building in square meters. Field populated using PCS:USA_Contiguous_Albers_Equal_Area_Conic_USGS based on pre-regularized geometries
This is the two-dimensional area of the building in square feet. Field populated using PCS:USA_Contiguous_Albers_Equal_Area_Conic_USGS based on pre-regularized geometries
This is the highest elevation (in meters) of the ground adjacent to the structure as estimated from available elevation data.
This is the lowest elevation (in meters) of the ground adjacent to the structure as estimated from available elevation data.
US County Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) Code (5 digit).

codesetd.codesetn: 2020 FIPS Codes for Counties and County Equivalent Entities

attr.attrdef: Census tract identifier; a concatenation of current state Federal Information Processing Series (FIPS) code, county FIPS code, and census tract code.
The date that the structure/feature was captured using automated methods (MM/DD/YYYY).
This is the name of the contractor or the government agency that created the feature.
United States National Grid Coordinate.
Longitude of located point on centroid of structure in millionths of decimal degrees.
Latitude of located point on centroid of structure in millionths of decimal degrees.

The catalog ID from the Maxar commercial imagery, or the name of the image from National Agriculture Imagery Program (NAIP) imagery used to extract structures. LiDAR-derived footprints provided by the National Geospatial Intelligence Agency (NGA). For LiDAR-derived footprints, the first portion of the name ('LiXXX') denotes the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) production code while the latter portion is the city/project covered.
This is the date of the imagery or LiDAR from which the building outline was captured (MM/DD/YYYY).
Methodology used to validate building outline as a true positive.

edom.edomvd: A manual visual inspection using the image in IMAGE_NAME to validate building outline as a true positive.

Feature was evaluated by an algorithm. The algorithm generates probabilities representing the likelihood of each feature being a true positive. Features that have a 50% or higher chance of being a true positive are excluded from the review process and are assumed to be valid.
Feature has not been formally reviewed.

attr.attrdef: This is comments that cannot be captured by existing data fields.

Universally Unique Identifier (method 4); a 128-bit id label coded in hexadecimal as a string in '{8-4-4-4-12}' format. Each structure within the complete USA Structures database will have a unique UUID. https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4122.html
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
